data.title: Very good Thai
data.text: I am not an expert on Thai food but I have enjoyed everything I have eaten at Kenaree.  The food seems to improve each time we visit.  I am happy to have such a nice little place to enjoy Thai food served by such nice people.

data.title: We love this place - Just wish it was a little more efficient
data.text: This is a hidden gem in Manteca.  The food is quite good.  Service is iffy.  I'm not sure if they still deliver.... that was a fiasco.  Almost 2 hours.  Highly recommend ordering for pickup.  Everything we've ever ordered was delicious.

data.title: Good food and portions for very fair price!
data.text:
Located in old downtown Manteca,this restaurant only has about 12 tables, and seems to also do a good takeout business.  We ate early, having just done the self guided tour of the historic Manteca Mural Project. The air conditioning was a welcome relief from the hot afternoon. 

We had their fresh spring rolls, a traditional Pad Thai with prawns, a Chicken Sautee with Cloud Ear mushrooms, lemon grass and mushrooms, and a vegetarian rice dish. It was all very tasty, and nicely presented.The portions were large, our order could have easily fed 3 people so we had leftovers for later which was just fine! The price was very good too, 4 dishes plus 2 ice teas and a good tip came to less than $50.

I will say this, they asked if we wanted mild, medium or hot, and we chose medium 
to be safe since Thai food is often very spicy hot. Their medium was not hot at all, so next time I would go with hot so it's more like traditional Thai cuisine.

data.title: Nice Tiny Thai Restaurant
data.text: We eat here a lot.  It's a small restaurant but the food is great.  I must admit that sometimes they are slow but the wait is worth it in my opinion.  One should relax when eating so just chill out.

data.title: Surprising little place!
data.text: I was taken aback at how small this place was. Another Thai restaurant that I was looking forward to was closed on Sunday, but this place was open! And I'm glad it was. The food was delicious. The only reason I couldn't give it five stars was the service was not that great. The young gentleman took a while to take our order and not to mention a lot longer to wipe down our table. There is about 8 tables to wait on so I was a little disappointed with the service. The food made up for it though. I'll be eating here again today.

data.title: Small but perfect
data.text:
My family and I are from the UK and after visiting Yosemite stopped overnight in Manteca, what a great find this little place was. The food was really tasty and the portions so big you will be taking some home .The staff are friendly and helpful, even the chef comes up front to ask if you enjoyed your meal. I don't experience service  like that in some of the top restaurants I go to in London. 
If we are ever this way again Kinnaree will be the place we head for.

data.title: Tiny Thai
data.text: We've eaten here a few times and the food is fine.  The restaurant is tiny and many folks don't even know about it.  My parents eat Vegan and this place definitely provides them quality food.  Otherwise, it is standard Thai and I wasn't too impressed by it.

data.title: Little secret gem
data.text: Really great food.  Ate here after seeing reviews.  I was not disappointed.  The whole menu looked good.  Ending up having waitress pick my order. Had shrimp veggies and noodles. Can't remember name just #46 on menu.  Had fresh spring rolls with peanut sauce.  I am stuffed and satisfied.   If you are craving thai. This place is great. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Small but a gem for sure! Amazing food! Great service! I absolutely love the pad thai! Definitely going back!

data.title: Delicious food!
data.text: The food was wonderful!  Very colorful and flavorful.  The servings were good sized, and we even had leftovers for lunch!  One of the best Thai restaurants that I have eaten in, and I have been to many in California.

data.title: My absolute favorite Thai restaurant in California
data.text: I was in Manteca for an extended business assignment in 2013.  I think I ate here  at least 25x every month! The yellow curry is fabulous! They seem to do a nice take - out trade too and know lots and lots of folks.  Highly recommend for both lunch and dinner.

data.title: A Pleasant Surprise
data.text: We wondered whether it was worth going into Stockton for dinner, but were a bit tired and did not much fancy another session on the congested and, frankly, grim freeway.   Looking for a change from Mexican, we noted that the Kimmaree had had good reviews.   It was not far from our hotel and we found it without too much difficulty.   We had an excellent meal.   The som tam (papaya salad), Pad Thai and Chicken with Cashews were delicious and, as the waitress found that we had lived in Thailand, the servings were served 'Ped' (with extra chillies).  The restaurant is run by a very nice South-East Asian family (he is Lao, she, Khmer, but they certainly know their Thai food) and their charming daughter serves at table.  We had a long chat with them after dinner about, among other things, Khao Suey, a rice and curry dish which is a speciality of Chang Mai and very difficult to find outside of the north-west of Thailand.  After that nostalgia-fest it came assomething of a culture shock as we emerged from the restaurant and found ourselves in Manteca.

data.title: Good food in Manteca
data.text: We were looking for a restaurant for dinner and almost didn't see this one because it isn't right on the street.  It is pleasant inside, and the food was delicious.   We ordered a curry dish and one with noodles.

data.title: Great Som Tam!
data.text: On a whim, we stopped here for lunch on our way to Yosemite.  I am very happy we did!  The owners were great hosts and created a family friendly atmosphere.  The Som Tam (Thai Green Papaya Salad) and Pad Thai were both excellent.  I will be back on my next trip.

data.title: one of my favorites
data.text: Kimmaree Thai is one of my favorite thai places. Being local I go there all the time. Great food and nice employees.

data.title: Wonderful food, quaint atmosphere
data.text: We were passing through town after a long day at Yosemite. While on the main street through town, Kinnaree is a bit hard to spot. The food was excellent...  Fresh and very flavorful!! The service was amazing. Very kind, accomodating, and welcoming employees!  It's a very small and quiet restaurant and I would absolutely return if I ever get the chance!

data.title: Great Thai find..
data.text: visiting the area, enjoyed lunch several times at this restaurant. All the meals were delicious and took me back to visiting Thailand. Fresh cooked you only have a short wait, simple setting but neat and clean. My only bother was a persistant fly. I'll be back.
